description: After the failed citywide conference, Sven Halek quietly reviews the remnants of Halden's original BCI code and faces a personal dilemma: expose painful truths or use the system to promote stability. He decides to discreetly authorize resumption of the dormant 'guidance protocol.'
Residents in several districts wake up to system advisories from a reactivated BCI subsystem, offering enigmatic but peaceful guidance for neighborhood disputes and encouraging cooperative solutions.

Many neighborhoods begin following the system's guidance, achieving unexpected compromises and easing cross-district shortages, though suspicion divides residents over the source and intent of the advisories.
Technicians confirm the reactivated guidance protocol is based on previously unpublished code from Halden's earliest BCI pilots, sparking heated public debate about whether the advice can be trusted.

Neighborhood assemblies hold formal votes on whether to continue listening to BCI advisories. The city divides between those who seek system guidance and those who demand a future free from its influence.
